title: Prince Harry and Meghan Join William and Kate Outside Windsor Castle
description: Prince William, Princess Catherine, Prince Harry and Meghan all visited crowds gathered to remember the queen.

title: As Russians Retreat, Putin Is Criticized by Hawks Who Trumpeted His War
description: Russian bloggers reporting from the front line provide a uniquely less-censored view of the war. But as Russia’s military flails, these once vocal supporters are exposing its flaws, lies and all.

title: King Charles III Is Formally Proclaimed to His New Role
description: Charles will spend much of the first 10 days of his reign leading his country in mourning the queen, whose state funeral will be held on Sept. 19 in Westminster Abbey.

title: How Ukraine Gained Momentum Against Russia and Took a Critical Hub
description: For months, Russia used the city of Izium as a way station to resupply and reinforce its troops in their campaign to seize the eastern Donbas region. With a northern offensive, Ukraine has retaken the city.

title: Queen Elizabeth’s Funeral Will Be on Sept. 19 at Westminster Abbey
description: On Sunday, Elizabeth’s coffin will be carried from Balmoral Castle, in the Scottish Highlands, on a roundabout, six-hour journey to Edinburgh, via Aberdeen.

title: Queen’s Death Leaves U.K. Grappling With Its Sense of National Identity
description: A figure who embodied Britain, Elizabeth cast long shadow. She leaves behind a country unsettled by domestic crises and anxiety over its place in the world.

title: Thousands of Sunflowers: Mourners Pay Tribute to Queen Elizabeth at Windsor Castle
description: “She was a ray of sunshine to so many people,” said Natalie Prince, a Windsor florist who said she had sold 8,000 sunflowers on Saturday.

title: Gun Violence Epidemic Looms Over Swedish Election
description: The far right has made strides by tying the longstanding issue to immigration, while Sweden’s center-left party is blaming it on failed integration to fight an exceptionally tight race.

title: ‘Glorious’ Hero or ‘Deplorable’ Traitor? Pétain’s Legacy Haunts French Island
description: Philippe Pétain, who led France to victory in World War I and then collaborated with the Nazis, is buried on a small island, where his grave is the site of bitter debates over his legacy.

title: In an ancient ceremony with a modern twist, King Charles III is formally proclaimed to his new role.
TV’s Prequel-Mania
description: This fall, if you feel like you’ve seen that new series somewhere before, you’re probably right.

title: Read King Charles III’s declaration to the Accession Council.
description: In the address, the king mourned the death of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, and said, “I am deeply aware of this great inheritance and of the duties and heavy responsibilities of sovereignty which have now passed to me.”

title: A Time of Horror in a Place of Family and Beauty
description: The mass murder in the James Smith Cree Nation is not the first killing that many members of the community link to crystal meth.

title: Hong Kong Sentences 5 Over ‘Seditious’ Children’s Books
description: Tales about a sheep village resisting a wolf pack prompted the charges against leaders of a speech therapists’ union, extending a government crackdown on dissent.

title: With Tears and Steel, Kenya’s ‘Hustler’ President Vanquishes His Foes
description: William Ruto built a career on beating the odds. In his greatest triumph, he is expected to be inaugurated as Kenya’s fifth president on Tuesday.

title: These maps show how Ukraine is rapidly advancing around Izium.
Live Updates: King Charles Is Set to Formally Accede to Throne
description: The ceremony, near Buckingham Palace, will be televised for the first time. A proclamation will be read and heralds will travel on horseback across the nation to deliver the news.

title: In His First Speech, King Charles III Pledges Service to Britain
description: On a day of mourning in Britain after the death of Queen Elizabeth, Charles’s ascent to the throne was a symbol of the continuity of the monarchy.

title: Ukraine Will Need $349 Billion to Rebuild, World Bank Says
description: The economy has contracted sharply while the cost of war grows, putting pressure on the government to decide whether to meet current needs or focus on recovery, the report said.

title: For Ukraine, the Fight Is Often a Game of Bridges
description: The southern counteroffensive has been a painstaking battle of river crossings, with pontoon bridges as prime targets for both sides. But so far, it is Ukraine that has advanced.
